author: Swati Pandey
description: The US State Department has signed off on the potential sale of military hardware to Australia valued at an estimated $2 billion (A$3.1 billion), including fighter jet spare parts.
title: US Approves Sale of $2 Billion in Military Hardware to Australia

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump is cutting short his visit to the Group of Seven leaders’ summit, according to the White House, and returning to Washington.
title: Trump to Leave G-7 Summit and Return to Washington on Monday

author: Ari Natter
description: Senate Republicans released a bill that would end tax credits for wind and solar earlier than for other sources, dashing hopes of those seeking relief from major cuts passed by the House.
title: Wind, Solar Credits Set to End Earlier in Senate GOP Tax Bill

author: Alicia Diaz
description: The Senate’s draft tax bill calls for temporarily increasing an investment credit for semiconductor manufacturers, enhancing a subsidy for chipmakers to build factories in the US.
title: Trump Tax Bill to Boost Biden’s Semiconductor Tax Credit to 30%

author: Ellen Milligan, Josh Wingrove
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer reached an agreement with US President Donald Trump to implement trading terms disclosed last month to slash US tariffs on key British exports and raise UK quotas on certain American agricultural products.
title: Starmer, Trump Agree to Implement Tariff-Cutting Trade Deal

author: Steven T. Dennis, Ye Xie
description: Senate Republicans plan to delay and make less onerous a levy targeting foreign companies and investors from countries that the US determines have been unfairly taxing US companies.
title: Senate Delays and Scales Back ‘Revenge Tax’ in Trump Bill

author: Josh Wingrove
description: US President Donald Trump indicated at the Group of Seven summit that he is in no rush to impose tougher sanctions on Russia, dismissing pressure from allied leaders eager to do more to push Moscow to the negotiating table.
title: Trump Says Russia Sanctions Would Cost US ‘a Lot of Money’

author: Amanda Albright
description: Wealthy US colleges scored a win on Monday with the release of Senate Republicans’ tax bill, which would institute a lower tax increase on endowments than what GOP House members have backed.
title: Rich Colleges Would Face Lower Tax Hike Under Senate Bill

author: Sakura Murakami
description: US President Donald Trump and Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba met for 30 minutes on the sidelines of the Group of Seven summit on Monday, according to the Japanese government.
title: Trump, Ishiba Meet at G-7 as Japanese Leader Seeks Trade Deal

author: Erik Wasson
description: Senate Republicans would cut trillions of dollars in taxes for households in their version of President Donald Trump’s signature economic package, a plan that comes at the expense of curbing health coverage for some low-income Americans and adding to US deficits.
title: Senate Republicans Release Revised Tax Cuts and Debt Limit Bill

author: Nathan R Dean
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Solar May Get a Dash of Hot Sauce in Senate Version of Tax Bill

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: Senate Republicans are proposing cuts to the Medicaid program for low-income and disabled people that are more aggressive than policies the House passed to help pay for President Donald Trump’s sweeping tax package, according to people familiar with the legislation.
title: Senate Republicans Propose More Aggressive Medicaid Cuts to Help Pay for Tax Bill

author: Scott Carpenter
description: A handful of Democratic senators are asking key government officials including Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent for information regarding a meeting this week where Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac may be discussed.
title: Democratic Senators Request Details of Upcoming Housing Meeting

author: Damian Garde
description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s decision to overhaul a key committee on vaccine policy has left the country’s vaccine infrastructure “critically weakened,” former members of the group said in a piece published in JAMA on Monday.
title: RFK Jr.’s Policy Moves Are Weakening Vaccine Infrastructure, Fired Advisers Say

author: Ellen Milligan, Josh Wingrove
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer is set to agree Monday with President Donald Trump to implement a trade deal announced last month to slash US tariffs on key British exports and raise UK quotas on certain American agricultural products, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Starmer, Trump Set to Agree to Implement Tariff-Cutting Pact

author: Chris Dolmetsch
description: The Trump administration won dismissal of a lawsuit by two unions seeking to stop the withholding of $400 million in federal funds from Columbia University, saying the groups didn’t have the legal right to challenge the decision.
title: US Defeats Teachers Unions’ Lawsuit to Restore Columbia Funding

author: Courtney McBride
description: Israel will pursue its military operations against Iran regardless of the progress of any potential negotiations involving the US, Israeli Strategic Affairs Minister Ron Dermer said in an interview on Bloomberg Television.
title: Israel to Continue Strikes Despite Reports Iran Seeks Talks

author: Erik Wasson
description: The Senate’s version of President Donald Trump’s tax bill calls for a $10,000 cap on the state and local tax deduction — a placeholder figure as Republicans remain divided over the valuable tax break.
title: Senate Deadlocked on SALT, With Draft Bill Showing Current $10,000 Cap

author: Josh Wingrove, Alberto Nardelli
description: The US is refusing to back a proposed Group of Seven statement urging Israel and Iran to de-escalate their conflict, people familiar with the matter said, underscoring divisions between the Trump administration and the rest of the bloc.
title: US Refuses to Back G-7 Push Urging Iran, Israel to De-Escalate

author: Dan Williams
description: More than two-thirds of Israelis back their country’s airstrikes against Iran, though fewer than a quarter believe it’s possible to end the threat seen from Tehran’s nuclear program without US assistance, an opinion poll found.
title: Most Israelis Back Iran Strikes But Are Split Over Continuing, Poll Shows

author: Jonathan Tirone
description: Iran could be poised to withdraw from an international accord that seeks to prevent the spread of nuclear weapons. This follows growing tensions with the United Nations’ atomic watchdog, compounded by Israel’s attacks on the Islamic Republic’s nuclear program.
title: What to Know About the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty as Iran Mulls Exit

author: David Voreacos, Anika Arora Seth
description: A federal judge said that Harvard University is likely to show that it will suffer irreparable harm if the government is able to stop international students from attending the Ivy League school.
title: Harvard Judge Says Foreign Student Ban Likely to Harm School

author: Jorge Valero
description: The Group of Seven leading economies are working to shore up supplies of critical minerals as they seek to move away from reliance on China for materials used in everything from mobile phones to wind turbines.
title: G-7 Works to Secure Critical Minerals in Face of China Curbs

author: Olivia Fletcher
description: The Irish state has launched its final share sale with AIB Group Plc, reducing its stake in the lender to zero and putting it into private ownership.
title: Irish State to Exit AIB, Putting Bank Into Private Ownership

author: Madlin Mekelburg
description: The US Department of Justice urged a federal appeals court to overturn a lower court’s order that limits the Trump administration’s use of National Guard troops in Los Angeles in response to protests over the president’s immigration raids.
title: US Urges Appeals Court to Allow National Guard Troops in LA

author: Josh Wingrove, Stephanie Lai
description: President Donald Trump said Iran wants to talk about de-escalating the conflict with Israel even as the two sides exchanged fire for the fourth consecutive day.
title: Trump Says Iran Wants to Talk After Waves of Israeli Airstrikes

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Russia said the US canceled the next round of planned consultations aimed at removing “irritants” from their bilateral relations and restoring the work of diplomatic missions in each other’s countries.
title: Russia Says US Canceled Planned Meeting on Bilateral Relations

author: Daniel Basteiro, Clara Hernanz Lizarraga
description: Spain’s Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said he sees no evidence of illegal financing within the Socialist Party as a corruption scandal that forced the resignation of a top aide continues to roil his government.
title: Spain’s Premier Sees No Sign of Illegal Financing in the Party

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: Chile presidential hopeful Carolina Toha stepped up criticism of the other contenders on the center-left during a debate Monday as her popularity fades with less than two weeks to go before a primary.
title: Chile’s Toha Ratchets Up Attacks as Presidential Primary Nears

author: Ellen Milligan, Josh Wingrove
description: US President Donald Trump and UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer will meet Monday as they work to finalize a trade pact between their two nations that would be the first such deal since the White House announced a string of punitive tariffs against countries worldwide.
title: Starmer Aims to Make Progress With Trump on UK-US Trade Pact

author: Zoltan Simon
description: Budapest’s mayor said the Hungarian capital would organize this year’s Pride parade under its own auspices to shield it from attempts by national authorities to ban the LGBTQ event.
title: Budapest Mayor to Stage Pride Parade Over Orban’s Opposition

author: Jorge Valero
description: European Union trade chief Maros Sefcovic is expected to meet with US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer on the sidelines of the Group of Seven meeting in Alberta, Canada, according to a person familiar with the plan.
title: EU’s Sefcovic to Meet US’s Greer at G-7 to Talk Trade, Tariffs

author: Katarina Hoije, Diakaridia Dembele
description: A Malian court ruled that Barrick Mining Corp.’s Loulo-Gounkoto gold mining complex should be placed under provisional administration for six months, handing control of one of the Canadian company’s biggest operations to state-appointed management.
title: Mali Court Puts Barrick Gold Mine Under Six Months State Control

author: Aaron Eglitis
description: Latvian authorities detained and questioned the leader of a political party catering to the country’s Russian-speaking minority for allegedly inciting hatred in parliament earlier this month.
title: Latvia Questions Party Leader for Russian Comments in Parliament

author: David Herbling
description: Kenya’s Deputy Inspector General Eliud Lagat agreed to “step aside” to allow for a probe to be carried out into the death of a man while in police custody.
title: Kenya Police Boss Steps Down for Murder Probe Amid Protests

description: Attendees at the G7 Media Centre before the G7 Leaders' Summit in Banff, Alberta, on June 15. Photographer: Bloomberg/Bloomberg
title: Updates From G-7 Summit

author: Jorge Valero, Alberto Nardelli, Ewa Krukowska
description: The European Union faces an uphill struggle to lower the Russian oil price cap after US opposition at the Group of Seven summit and a crude price spike driven by Iran-Israel tensions.
title: EU Faces Struggle to Cut Russia Oil Price Cap on Mideast Risk

author: Leen Al-Rashdan, Samy Adghirni, Siddharth Vikram Philip, Kate Duffy
description: French officials blocked off the exhibits of several Israeli weapons makers at the Paris Air Show on Monday, leading to protests and finger pointing over who was to blame.
title: Israeli Weapons Displays Covered at Paris Air Show, Sparking Protests

author: Salah Slimani
description: Algeria’s parliament approved legislation allowing foreign companies to own as much of 80% of mining projects, a step change for the OPEC country seeking to diversify its economy.
title: Algeria Opens Door to Larger Foreign Role in Mining Projects

author: Amanda Albright, Francesca Maglione, Elizabeth Rembert, Ann Choi
description: Arizona State University President Michael Crow is proud that his school is home to more international students — about 17,000 — than any other public institution in the US.
title: Trump’s Higher-Ed Fight Comes for Public Schools in States That Voted for Him

author: Paul Wallace, Galit Altstein
description: As Iran fires masses of ballistic missiles, Israel’s vaunted air defenses are being tested like never before.
title: Israel’s Air Shield Is Tested Like Never Before as Iran Fires Ballistic Missiles

author: Kelcee Griffis, Ashley Carman
description: President Donald Trump is launching a Trump-branded mobile phone service, that will rely on wireless networks and hardware that is “made in America.”
title: Trump Launches Self-Branded Mobile Phone Service in the US

author: Wes Kosova
description: Leaders aren’t racing to make deals despite White House pressure.
title: US Allies and Adversaries Are Dodging Trump’s Tariff Threats

author: Erik Wasson, Chris Cioffi, Nancy Cook
description: Senate Republicans plan to unveil key details of their version of President Donald Trump’s giant economic policy bill as soon as Monday, with the party pushing to enact the $3 trillion tax package by July 4.
title: Senate to Unveil Trump Tax Bill Draft With SALT Fight Unresolved

author: Gresa Kraja
description: Kosovo’s Prime Minister Albin Kurti called on US President Donald Trump to pressure neighboring Serbia into normalizing relations with his country, whose independence Belgrade does not recognize.
title: Kosovo Premier Calls on Trump to Press Serbia to Normalize Ties

author: Alex Wickham
description: Keir Starmer’s government will shortly publish a new national security strategy that will broaden the scope of what is considered vital to UK interests to include critical domestic industries, crime and the online world, a shift that could help Britain meet a proposed new NATO target on defense spending.
title: UK Widens National Security Remit in a Step Toward NATO Target

author: Olivia Fletcher
description: Irish government ministers have warned public finances will need to be more carefully managed, signaling a shift in approach ahead of the next budget as global trade turmoil is expected to slow growth in the small, open economy.
title: Ireland Signals Budget Caution on Rising Global Trade Risks

author: Anthony Halpin
description: The Russian leader has strong links with both Israel and Iran.
title: Putin Is Walking a Fine Line Between Trump and Tehran

author: Andrea Palasciano, Tom Mackenzie
description: Luxembourg Prime Minister Luc Frieden threw his weight behind calls for the European Union to issue joint debt to fund defense spending and measures to tackle climate change.
title: Luxembourg PM Backs Calls for Joint EU Debt for Defense, Climate

author: Jonathan Tirone
description: The United Nations atomic watchdog is convening an emergency meeting to assess Israel’s attacks on Iranian nuclear facilities, along with their disruption on oversight of the Islamic Republic’s stockpile of near-bomb grade uranium.
title: Status of Iran’s Near-Bomb Grade Uranium Stock Looms Over IAEA

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand called for more bilateral talks with Cambodia to resolve a simmering border dispute after Phnom Penh threatened to permanently shut land crossings between the two countries and halt Thai imports.
title: Thailand Seeks More Talks With Cambodia as Border Row Lingers

author: Weilun Soon
description: Navigation signals from more than 900 vessels in the Strait of Hormuz and the Persian Gulf went awry over the weekend, creating confusion in the shipping chokepoint as the fighting between Iran and Israel intensified.
title: Ship Signal Jamming in Persian Gulf Worsens as Conflict Widens

author: David Herbling
description: An International Monetary Fund mission is in Kenya for two weeks to assess the impact of corruption on public finances, with the findings expected to inform a new program requested by the government.
title: IMF Graft Audit Team Lands in Kenya Ahead of Fresh Program Talks

author: Ram Anand
description: Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said there’s no need for a cabinet reshuffle even with Economy Minister Rafizi Ramli set to depart on Tuesday.
title: Malaysia PM Says No Cabinet Reshuffle After Ministers Quit

author: Derek Wallbank
description: The man suspected of killing a Democratic state lawmaker and her husband in Minnesota has been taken into custody, the Ramsey County Sheriff’s Office said.
title: Suspect in Shootings of Minnesota Lawmakers in Custody

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: More than 6,000 North Korean soldiers are believed to have been injured or killed while fighting in Russia’s Kursk region in support of Moscow’s war on Ukraine, according to estimates by British intelligence, underscoring North Korean leader Kim Jong Un’s role as a key ally of President Vladimir Putin in a war now in its fourth year.
title: UK Intelligence Estimates 6,000 North Korean Casualties in Kursk

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump directed federal officials to expand efforts to deport migrants in the largest US cities in the face of protests and court challenges, even as his administration is looking to ease the impact of the crackdown on key sectors of the US workforce.
title: Trump Says ICE Ordered to Expand Deportations in Largest Cities Including New York and Chicago

author: Alastair Gale
description: Public support for Japan’s prime minister is holding up after the government moved to address high rice prices, according to new opinion polls, a positive sign for Shigeru Ishiba as he heads into an election and tries to reach a trade agreement with the US.
title: Polls Show Support for Japan’s Ishiba Recovering Before Election

author: Josh Xiao
description: China’s government is reviewing impacts on the nation’s scientific research after President Donald Trump’s moves to withdraw funding from some US agencies and halt publication of certain categories of data.
title: China Reviews Impact of US Data Curbs Due to Trump’s Budget Cuts

author: Arsalan Shahla, Galit Altstein
description: Open hostilities between Israel and Iran entered a fourth day on Monday with no sign of easing, stoking fears of a wider war in the oil-rich region.
title: Israel-Iran Attacks Extend to Fourth Day With No Deal in Sight
